qas.question: What kind of work was the FBI focused on?
How many LEGAT offices does the FBI operate?
Why does the FBI operate LEGAT offices?
Do LEGAT offices conduct unilateral operations in host countries?
How many LEGAT offices does the CIA operate?
How many sub-offices in U.S. embassies does the CIA have?
Why does the CIA operate LEGAT offices?
What intelligence agency conducts unilateral operations in host countries?
What is not important in overseas operations?

context: Despite its <a0_0>domestic<a0_0/> focus, the FBI also maintains a significant international footprint, operating <a1_0><b5_0>60<b5_0/><a1_0/> Legal Attache (LEGAT) offices and <b6_0>15<b6_0/> sub-offices in U.S. embassies and consulates across the globe. These overseas offices exist primarily for the purpose of <a2_0><b7_0>coordination with foreign security services<b7_0/><a2_0/> and do <a3_0>not usually<a3_0/> conduct unilateral operations in the host countries. The FBI can and does at times carry out secret activities overseas, just as the <b8_0>CIA<b8_0/> has a limited domestic function; these activities generally require <a4_0><b9_0>coordination<b9_0/><a4_0/> across government agencies.
